name: client-grpc

jsDoc.doc: ConnectRPC client interface.
Make a unary RPC call.
Make a server streaming RPC call.
Make a client streaming RPC call.
Make a bidirectional streaming RPC call.
Close the client connection.
Client configuration
Reflection API (only available when schema: "reflection")
Base error class for ConnectRPC/gRPC errors.
Options for ConnectRpcError construction.
Headers/metadata from the ConnectRPC response.
Rich error details from google.rpc.Status.
Error thrown for internal server errors (code 13).
Error thrown when the requested resource is not found (code 5).
Options for individual ConnectRPC calls.
Metadata to send with the request.

Whether to throw ConnectRpcError on non-OK responses (code !== 0).
Overrides ConnectRpcClientConfig.throwOnError.

tags.value: @default true (when not specified in client config)

jsDoc.doc: Error thrown when the client lacks permission (code 7).
Error thrown when a resource is exhausted (code 8).
ConnectRPC response interface.

Get deserialized response data.
Returns the response message as-is (already deserialized by Connect).
Returns null if the response is an error or has no data.
Get raw response or error.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"connectrpc"` for ConnectRPC responses. Use this in switch statements
for type-safe narrowing of union types.

Whether the request was successful (statusCode === 0).

Inherited from ClientResult. True when statusCode is 0 (OK),
false for any error code.

ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.

0 indicates success (OK). Non-zero values represent various error conditions
compatible with gRPC status codes.

Status message (null for successful responses).

Contains error description when ok is false.

Response headers.

HTTP headers sent at the beginning of the response.

Response trailers (sent at end of RPC).

Additional metadata sent after the response body in streaming RPCs.

Response time in milliseconds.

Inherited from ClientResult. Measures the full RPC duration.
Human-readable names for ConnectRPC/gRPC status codes.

ConnectRPC/gRPC status codes.
These codes are used by both gRPC and ConnectRPC protocols.
Error thrown when the client is not authenticated (code 16).
Error thrown when the service is unavailable (code 14).

Rich error detail from google.rpc.Status.

ConnectRPC errors can include structured details encoded in error responses.
These details follow the google.protobuf.Any format with a type URL and value.

Type URL identifying the error detail type.
Common types include:
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.BadRequest"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.DebugInfo"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.RetryInfo"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.QuotaFailure"

Decoded error detail value.
The structure depends on the typeUrl.

FileDescriptorSet message type from @bufbuild/protobuf.
This is the decoded protobuf message containing file descriptors.
Get the name of a ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.
Check if a number is a valid ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.

tags.doc:
```typescript
isConnectRpcStatusCode(0);   // true
isConnectRpcStatusCode(16);  // true
isConnectRpcStatusCode(99);  // false
```

Configuration for creating a gRPC client.

This is a subset of ConnectRpcClientConfig with protocol fixed to "grpc".

Create a new gRPC client instance.

This is a thin wrapper around `createConnectRpcClient` with `protocol: "grpc"` fixed.
The client provides Server Reflection support for runtime service discovery.
